title: How to Check What Kind of Android Phone You Have

steps.title: Examine your phone's housing.
steps.content: Examine your phone's housing. The brand of your phone should appear on the face or back of your phone.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap About phone.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap About phone . It's in the "System" section. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Look at the "Model number" section.
steps.content: Look at the "Model number" section. This is your phone's model number. You can Google your phone's model number to find out more about your phone.

steps.title: Look at the "Android version" section.
steps.content: Look at the " Android version " section. This is the version of Android your phone is running.

steps.title: Tap Regulatory information.
steps.content: Tap Regulatory information . It's in the "System" section. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Look at the "Manufacturer name" section.
steps.content: Look at the "Manufacturer name" section. This is the maker of your phone.

steps.title: Power off
steps.content: Power off your phone. If your phone is in a case, remove it from the case.

steps.title: Remove the back cover from the housing.
steps.content: Remove the back cover from the housing.

steps.title: Examine the manufacturer's sticker.
steps.content: Examine the manufacturer's sticker. It will list the brand and the model number, as well as where and when your phone was made. [3] X Research source
